Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the University of Florida is dropping its computer science department, when in reality, it is considering merging it with another department.
Understate: The claim understates the complexity of reallocating funds from athletics to academics, suggesting that it is easy to do so.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that cutting the computer science department would save the same amount of money that is being added to athletics.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that it is unfair to allocate a large budget to athletics while cutting an engineering program, without considering other factors or priorities.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that the university may have legitimate reasons for reallocating funds, such as financial constraints or strategic priorities.
